DataElement.preferredName: First Disease Recurrence CA-125 Antigen Result Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown/not applicable indicator relating to information regarding an antigen expressed by tissues derived from mullerian epithelium (tubal, endometrial and endocervical) or celomic epithelium (mesothelial cells of the pleura, pericardium and peritoneum) useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment and recurrence of disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: First Disease Recurrence CA-125 Antigen Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._To occur again._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._To occur again._An antigen expressed by tissues derived from mullerian epithelium (tubal, endometrial and endocervical) or celomic epithelium (mesothelial cells of the pleura, pericardium and peritoneum).  Although its biochemical nature has not been clearly defined, CA125 has been described as a glycosylated, high-molecular-weight protein that may be released from damaged cells.  Measurable in plasma, CA125 is a sensitive, nonspecific tumor marker for ovarian cancer; as such it is much more useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment of ovarian cancer than for the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  Elevated plasma CA125 may occur in association with other malignancies and non-malignant gynecologic disorders. (NCI04)_Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredName: First Disease or Disorder Recurrence CA-125 Antigen
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:To occur again.:An antigen expressed by tissues derived from mullerian epithelium (tubal, endometrial and endocervical) or celomic epithelium (mesothelial cells of the pleura, pericardium and peritoneum).  Although its biochemical nature has not been clearly defined, CA125 has been described as a glycosylated, high-molecular-weight protein that may be released from damaged cells.  Measurable in plasma, CA125 is a sensitive, nonspecific tumour marker for ovarian cancer; as such it is much more useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment of ovarian cancer than for the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  Elevated plasma CA125 may occur in association with other malignancies and non-malignant gynecologic disorders.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

An antigen expressed by tissues derived from mullerian epithelium (tubal, endometrial and endocervical) or celomic epithelium (mesothelial cells of the pleura, pericardium and peritoneum).  Although its biochemical nature has not been clearly defined, CA125 has been described as a glycosylated, high-molecular-weight protein that may be released from damaged cells.  Measurable in plasma, CA125 is a sensitive, nonspecific tumor marker for ovarian cancer; as such it is much more useful for monitoring clinical responses to the treatment of ovarian cancer than for the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.  Elevated plasma CA125 may occur in association with other malignancies and non-malignant gynecologic disorders. (NCI04)

Property.preferredDefinition: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If biochemical recurrence, is
ReferenceDocuments.description: If biochemical recurrence, is the patient's CA-125 greater than or equal to two times the upper normal limit?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the CA-125 greater than or equal to two times the upper normal limit?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have rising CA-125 only, without RECIST 1.1 evaluable disease?
